tweets.content: @internetrebecca: Spreading open data best practices throughout America w @WhatWorksCities like Johnny Appleseed is important work + my great pleasure #IODC16pic.twitter.com/tulV3UnC6T

session.description: Session will provide an update on open data activities in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, and an opportunity to discuss how to improve collaboration regionally to increase the impacts of open data. What has been happening in the region since IODC 2015? What kind of advances have taken place...Read more

conference_notes: This debate brought together representatives from Canada, the United States and Mexico to discuss the open data landscape in the region with a strong focus on how the three countries are working on the implementation of standards for data in order to improve data quality. Also, progress focusing on demand-driven data availability was claimed to make more and more user-centered data applications to be developed. Finally, Beth Noveck  (GovLab) stressed the importance of a proactive data disclosure, instead of a reactive one, once demand of data is identified.
name: Regional Talks: North America
